page.title: 12EVENTS
page.content: One of the 'highlights' of the village year is the carnival. It is not an old tradition as it started in 1956 when an 'Old Tyme' Dance Club which had some spare money decided to stage a carnival. The centrepiece of the carnival is the procession which is comprised of floats, a brass band, jazz bands, a carnival queen and individuals in fancy dress. The fair also comes to the village. There are roundabouts, amusements and sideshows on the green. Other attracions of a 'fun' weekend are a 'Bonny Baby' competition, a talent contest and races, as well as writing, painting, drawing and many other competitions. On Saturday 13th July it was this years carnival. People dressed up in all kinds of unusual costumes. There was Torvil & Dean on rollerskates and a space man who won first prize.
